snippet: The measure, which bars the sale of sweetened drinks larger than 16 ounces, will take effect in six months unless blocked by a judge.
abstract: New York City Board of Health approves a controversial ban on the sale of large sodas and other sugary drinks at restaurants, street carts and movie theaters; measure, seeking to reduce increasing obesity rates, is the first of its kind in the country.
lead_paragraph: The measure, which bars the sale of sweetened drinks larger than 16 ounces, will take effect in six months unless blocked by a judge.

headline.seo: Health Board Approves Bloomberg’s Soda Ban
headline.main: Health Panel Approves Restriction on Sale of Large Sugary Drinks
headline.print_headline: Health Panel Approves Restriction on Sale of Large Sugary Drinks
